intro: Cyrtandra zamboangensis, commonly known as the Zamboanga cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and rocky areas. It has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
